title: The Glass Cannon's Guide to Not Dying
goal: Artie needs gear that doesn't rely on him being hit, as he can't take a single blow.
stakes_shift: Survival shifts from pure luck to tactical exploitation of the System's bugs.

bridge.from_prev: Artie is a marked man in Oakhaven.
bridge.to_next: Artie heads to the Low-Level Crypts to farm 'Evasion' gear.

sections.title: Shopping for Scraps
sections.intent: Equip Artie with the bare minimum gear required to survive a dungeon without taking damage.

scenes.summary: Artie tries to sell his 'Participation Trophy' but finds out it's soul-bound and cursed to attract hostility.
scenes.outcome: Artie is stuck with a lighthouse-beacon for monsters.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: Fizz points out a loophole in the 'Starter Pack' quest that allows Artie to steal a high-tier cloak if he can crit a lock.
scenes.outcome: Artie successfully crits a lock, causing it to explode into gold dust.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion,' which gives massive Evasion but a ridiculous neon appearance.
scenes.outcome: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion' and looks like a neon yellow cat.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.
scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion' and looks like a neon yellow cat.

sections.title: The Crypt of Bad Math
sections.intent: Test the Crit-build's resource farming potential in a controlled dungeon crawl.

scenes.summary: Artie enters the Crypts and finds that the skeletons move in predictable, turn-based patterns he can exploit.
scenes.outcome: Artie begins to treat the world like a rhythm game.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: A Skeleton Archer fires at Artie; the Cloak's evasion procs, causing Artie to do a physics-defying backflip.
scenes.outcome: Artie survives his first ranged encounter and gains confidence.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: Artie realizes his crits cause 'System Overload' effects, turning defeated enemies into loot-filled pinatas.
scenes.outcome: Artie discovers he can turn enemies into loot-filled pinatas via System Overload.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.
scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie discovers he can turn enemies into loot-filled pinatas via System Overload.

sections.title: The Rival's Shadow
sections.intent: Escalate the tension by showing Vane's power and forcing Artie into a boss encounter.

scenes.summary: Vane enters the crypts with a full party, clearing rooms with ease while Artie hides in a sarcophagus.
scenes.outcome: Artie sees the gap between a 'proper' build and his own.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: Vane's party leaves behind a 'Boss Trigger' item, which Artie decides to take to secure massive XP.
scenes.outcome: Artie decides to take the risk and summon the boss for the massive XP.
scenes.transition_out: This beat carries directly into the next location.

scenes.summary: The Floor Guardian, a Bone Golem, emerges, and Artie realizes he is woefully unprepared for its minimum damage floor.
scenes.outcome: The Bone Golem emerges, initiating a boss battle where Artie is at a massive disadvantage.
scenes.end_condition_echo: The Bone Golem emerges, initiating a boss battle where Artie is at a massive disadvantage.
